history.proof: srun best use: eqc_eqc_cA_1, eqc_exd_exd, cA_cA_1, eqc_cA_eqc unfold: cF.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> eqc m x y -> eqc m x (cF m y)

Premises:
dart = nat : Set
eqc = fix eqc (m : fmap) (x y : dart) {struct m} : Prop := match m with | V => False | I m0 x0 _ _ => x = x0 /\ y = x0 \/ eqc m0 x y | L m0 _ x0 y0 => eqc m0 x y \/ eqc m0 x x0 /\ eqc m0 y0 y \/ eqc m0 x y0 /\ eqc m0 x0 y end : fmap -> dart -> dart -> Prop
Inductive fmap : Set := V : fmap | I : fmap -> dart -> tag -> point -> fmap | L : fmap -> dim -> dart -> dart -> fmap
inv_hmap = fix inv_hmap (m : fmap) : Prop := match m with | V => True | I m0 x _ _ => inv_hmap m0 /\ prec_I m0 x | L m0 k0 x y => inv_hmap m0 /\ prec_L m0 k0 x y end : fmap -> Prop
cF = fun (m : fmap) (z : dart) => cA_1 m one (cA_1 m zero z) : fmap -> dart -> dart
eqc_cA_eqc : forall (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> eqc m x (cA m k y) -> eqc m x y
eqc_eqc_cA : forall (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> eqc m x y -> eqc m x (cA m k y)
eqc_eqc_cA_1 : forall (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> eqc m x y -> eqc m x (cA_1 m k y)
eqc_trans : forall (m : fmap) (x y z : dart), eqc m x y -> eqc m y z -> eqc m x z
eqc_symm : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), eqc m x y -> eqc m y x
eqc_cA_1_eqc : forall (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> eqc m (cA_1 m k x) y -> eqc m x y
eqc_exd_exd : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), eqc m x y -> exd m x /\ exd m y
MF.disjs_orb : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> exd m y -> ~ MF.expo m x y -> disjs (MF.Iter_orb m x) (MF.Iter_orb m y)
eqc_refl : forall (m : fmap) (x : dart), exd m x -> eqc m x x
eqc_dec : forall (m : fmap) (x y : dart), {eqc m x y} + {~ eqc m x y}
eqc_cA_1_r : forall (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> eqc m x (cA_1 m k x)
eqc_cA_r : forall (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> eqc m x (cA m k x)
MF.expo_between_3 : forall (m : fmap) (x y z : dart), inv_hmap m -> MF.expo1 m x y -> MF.expo1 m x z -> MF.between m x z y \/ MF.between m (MF.f m y) z (MF.f_1 m x)
prec_L = fun (m : fmap) (k : dim) (x y : dart) => exd m x /\ exd m y /\ ~ succ m k x /\ ~ pred m k y /\ cA m k x <> y : fmap -> dim -> dart -> dart -> Prop
MA0.incls_rem : forall (m : fmap) (x : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> incls (MA0.Iter_rem m x) (fmap_to_set m)
MF.incls_orbit : forall (m : fmap) (x : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> incls (MF.Iter_orb m x) (fmap_to_set m)
MA0.incls_orbit : forall (m : fmap) (x : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> incls (MA0.Iter_orb m x) (fmap_to_set m)
MA0.exds_orb_exd : forall (m : fmap) (x z : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m x -> exds (MA0.Iter_orb m x) z -> exd m z
McF.f_1_f : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m z -> cF_1 m (cF m z) = z
cF_1_cF : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m z -> cF_1 m (cF m z) = z
exd_cF : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m z < -> exd m (cF m z)
McF.exd_f : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m z < -> exd m (cF m z)
not_exd_D : forall (m : fmap) (x : dart), inv_hmap m -> ~ exd (D m x) x
MA1.L3 : forall (m : fmap) (z t : dart) (x : set), inv_hmap m -> exd m z -> exds x t -> let sr := MA1.Iter_rem_aux m z x in let zn0 := Iter (MA1.f m) (ndN m - card x) z in ~ exds sr t -> exds x zn0
MA0.exd_diff_orb : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), inv_hmap m -> exd m z -> MA0.diff_orb m z
predf_exd : forall (m : fmap) (z : dart), inv_hmap m -> predf m z -> exd m z
surj_cF : forall m : fmap, inv_hmap m -> surj_dart (exd m) (cF m)
inj_cF : forall m : fmap, inv_hmap m -> inj_dart (exd m) (cF m)
bij_cF : forall m : fmap, inv_hmap m -> bij_dart (exd m) (cF m)
McF.bij_f : forall m : fmap, inv_hmap m -> bij_dart (exd m) (cF m)

```coq
intros m x y Hinv Heqc.
rewrite <- (eqc_cA_1_eqc m one x y Hinv).
apply eqc_trans with (y := cA_1 m one y).
- apply eqc_refl.
  apply exd_cF, Hinv.
- apply eqc_cA_1_r, Hinv, exd_cF, Hinv.
Qed.```

original: intros m x y Hinv Heqc. rewrite <- (eqc_cA_1_eqc m one x y Hinv). apply eqc_trans with (y := cA_1 m one y). - apply eqc_refl. apply exd_cF, Hinv. - apply eqc_cA_1_r, Hinv, exd_cF, Hinv.
